alert.note: Alert for Beaver (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 01 at 1:46PM CDT until June 01 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of the Panhandle of Oklahoma, including the following county, Beaver. Portions of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Collingsworth, Donley, Gray, Hemphill, Lipscomb, Ochiltree, Roberts and Wheeler. * WHEN...Until 10 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Saturated soils from previous rainfall plus more rainfall expected this evening will lead to additional runoff and flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
